docs.text: Welcome to MkDocs For full documentation visit mkdocs.org . Commands mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project. mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server. mkdocs build - Build the documentation site. mkdocs -h - Print help message and exit. Project layout mkdocs.yml # The configuration file. docs/ index.md # The documentation homepage. ... # Other markdown pages, images and other files.
docs.title: Home

docs.text: Chapter 03 Basic Topology of \mathbb{R} Section 3.2 Open and Closed Sets 3.2.1 (a) Where in the proof of Theorem 3.2.3 part (ii) does the assumption that the collection of open sets be finite get used? Proof: (b) Give an example of a countable collection of open sets \left\{ O1,O2,O3, ... \right\} whose intersection \cap_{n=1}^\infty O_n is closed, not empty and not all of \mathbb{R} . Solution:
